intro: Bupleurum affine f. breviradiatum, commonly known as the short-rayed angelica, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescences. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
